intro: Schedonorus aureus, commonly known as the golden grass, is a perennial grass species native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fine, silver-green foliage and produces small, pale yellow to golden flowers in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Schedonorus aureus is also valued as a ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
